fields.headline: Warnock rules out Leeds move
fields.bodyText: Sheffield United boss Neil Warnock today reaffirmed his commitment to the club to end speculation linking him with Leeds. Warnock has until now refused to comment after being installed as one of the favourites to replace the sacked Peter Reid. But the Sheffield-born 54-year-old has started negotiations over a new contract, while there has been no official approach from Elland Road. Speaking on the club's official website, www.sufc.co.uk, Warnock said: "There has been no approach from Leeds and I've not given it a thought. I've been here four years changing this club around and we have made great strides - the carrot is in sight. "Everyone knows Sheffield United are my club and my aim is to get us into the Premiership. I'm enjoying every minute of it - I'm staying."
